headers.full: Distance of a Point from a Hyperplane
headers.toc: Distance of a Point from a Hyperplane

intro.para:
Here we learn how to determine the
distance of a point from a hyperplane
An illustration of this situation.
. This is a very practical problem which one can encounter in many
different guises
Examples of settings which lead to the problem of finding the distance of a point from a hyperplane.
Examples of situations which lead to the problem of finding the distance of a point from a hyperplane include:
The problem of determining the altitude of an air plane’s landing gear above the runway.
The problem of determining the distance of a ship from a straight shore line.
It will help you understand the scope of this problem if you find more examples yourself.
. Later, it will also enable us to carry out ‘least squares’ approximations. Happily, there is one simple formula which solves the problem of finding the distance of a point from a hyperplane completely and in all dimensions.
